review: From a technology standpoint I'd probably rate this 3 stars, but it fits perfectly into how I wanted to use. If you're looking to stream everything from your mobile devices then you're probably not going to be entirely happy. If you're looking to stream YouTube on your TV from your phone then you'll really enjoy it. It works pretty well with the supported applications and formats, but don't expect any other magical compatibility.

review: Consistency is important. It trumps innovation, style, fun, or any other adjective used to describe technology. I really wanted to like this. I'm an IT professional, who started my career cutting my teeth on DOS, motherboards, and device drivers. Therefore, I felt undaunted by the task of getting Chromecast to work well. I gave up. First, it wouldn't connect to my network because I was using a repeater. After, flashing the device with DD-WRT and reconfiguring it, I got the Chromecast to connect and it worked well with all devices. Until it didn't. Sometimes it would work. Other times it wouldn't. Reboot after reboot after factory reset ameliorated the issues temporarily. At one point, it worked with every app, except the one I really wanted - Netflix (it had worked with it before). At first I thought it was a defective unit, until I saw a whole lot of people having similar issues with the only answers being - reboot and factory reset.I guess I'm just getting too old. It's not entertaining anymore to fiddle endlessly with settings. I'm returning it and getting something that works - perhaps a Roku or Apple TV
author: Manuel Castaneda
